intro: Tadehagi triquetrum subsp. rodgeri, commonly known as the slender tansy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
